entity_resolver.scripts module¶

Implement command line interface to preprocess arxiv and citeseer data.

This is the implementaion file of command line tools entity-resolve prep-arxiv and entity-resolver prep-citeseer. For usage of the tools, please refer to Quickstart or use with -h flag for help menu. It also includes a python API: the run function for such preprocessing tasks, though it is primarily implemented for testing purpose.

Example

>>> from entity_resolver.scripts import run
>>> cmd_args = [
...     'prep-arxiv',
...     '--data', 'path/to/input_data',
...     '--graph', 'path/to/output_graph',
...     '--ground_truth', 'path/to/output_ground_truth'
... ]
>>> run(cmd_args)

The above example is equivalent to the terminal command:

$ entity-resolver prep-arxiv\
> --data path/to/input_data\
> --graph path/to/output_graph\
> --ground_truth path/to/output_ground_truth
entity_resolver.scripts.main()[source]¶

The command line script entry point.

entity_resolver.scripts.parse_data(data, graph, ground_truth, name)[source]¶

Preprocess either arxiv or citeseer data specified by name.

Parameters

  • data (str) – The path to the input data.

  • graph (str) – The path to the output graph data.

  • ground_truth (str) – The path to the output ground truth data.

  • name (str) – Either ‘arxiv’ or ‘citeseer’. Indicate which data is to be

  • preprocessed. –

Note

  • Only the third column named ‘normalized_author’ is included as attribute in the output graph file under the attribute name 'name'.

  • Also the rows with author id 2716 are removed in citeseer data during this process because multiple different rows with id 2716 are present, which does not make sense.

Return type

None

entity_resolver.scripts.run(args=None)[source]¶

Run prep-arxiv or prep-citeseer with console command input.

Parameters

args (Optional[Sequence[str]]) – A list of strings representing a terminal command. The original command can be obtained by joinning them with white spaces.

Return type

None
